Name: Magnet Forensic
Products:
We will be discussing the integrity and authentication of digital media evidence and the challenges of generative AI. Digital media plays a critical role in modern investigations but is often compromised by tampering, deepfakes, and missing metadata. Investigators need a trusted tool to validate media and provide legally defensible evidence. This is where Magnet Verify (formerly Medex) comes in. 

Unlike any other solution, Magnet Verify uncovers critical insights beyond standard metadata and visible content. By leveraging patented technology, it can detect alterations and AI-generated media, validate media authenticity, and trace the source of images and videos‚Äîensuring investigators can trust their evidence. Here‚Äôs how Magnet Verify supports investigators: 

    Streamlining CSAM investigations: Identify first-generation CSAM and rule out synthetic files. 
    Supporting legal proceedings: Provide attorneys and prosecutors with validated, court-admissible media evidence. 
    Authenticating citizen-submitted video: Confirm the authenticity of videos submitted via portals or social media to ensure actionable evidence.
People, products, information: Forensics tools to extract data from cell phone, and classifiers (including by Thorn). Was used by Russian law enforcement before sanctions. Is considered as an alternative to Cellebrite. From Forbes: Waterloo, Canada-based Magnet Forensics also secured its biggest federal contract to date in August, when ICE spent $5 million on licenses for Graykey, an Android and iPhone hacking tool. Magnet acquired the Graykey technology when it bought out Grayshift, an Atlanta startup cofounded by a former Apple employee in 2016, as first revealed by Forbes. Under the last Trump administration, ICE spent just over $1 million on Graykey tech. Later in August, ICE spent another $3 million on Magnet software, which helps investigators acquire and analyze data from smartphones and computers. Magnet hadn‚Äôt responded to a request for comment at the time of publication. OCCRP article on Magnet tools sold to Myanmar (pre-coup). They use as well Cellebrite tools.

Name: Phonexia
Products: Voice biometric engine "Voice Inspector" and other speech recognition tools. The Czech company says that the software can identify individuals from just three seconds of conversational speech and offers voice comparison accuracy regardless of language or spoken words. The new software offering meets the international standard for court admissibility, aligning with guidelines from the European Network of Forensic Science Institutes (ENFSI), according to the announcement.
People, products, information: Partner in EU Horizon 2020 research project Roxanne, along with Interpol and EU law enforcement bodies. Partner in Tensor, another Horizon project.

Name: Eyedea Recognition Ltd
Europol link: According to Thales, it already has a contract with Europol. According to this 2017 paper, its Eyedentity tool (a FRT), was used by Europol.
Products: Eyedea Recognition, a spin-off company of the Czech Technical University founded by researchers from the Department of Cybernetics. AI-powered traffic and vehicle image analysis showcased at RID 2025. But older relations: Eyedentity used by Europol since 2016
People, products, information: According to this Czech report by digital rights group IuRe, under its programme Digitalni Svobody: According to the statement of the Regional Police Directorate of the √öst√≠ nad Labem Region, before using the EyeDentity software, an assessment of the impact on personal data protection was not carried out pursuant to Section 37 of Act No. 110/3019 Coll., on the processing of personal data, nor was the processing by the software consulted with the Office for Personal Data Protection pursuant to Section 38 of Act No. 110/3019 Coll., on the processing of personal data.69 The obligation to prepare a personal data impact assessment also applies to the use of the EyeDentity software, as it is probable that the processing of biometric data by the EyeDentity software could have resulted in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons.70 In connection with whether or not a given processing is subject to a personal data impact assessment, a manual has been created by the Office for Personal Data Protection.71 The said manual contains a list of ten criteria, with the processing of personal data being divided into three levels according to each criterion: critical values, significant values, low values. The classification as processing with a high risk to the rights and freedoms of data subjects, and the associated obligations, is determined according to the number of levels achieved in the individual criteria. If the level of two or more criteria reaches critical, or if one level reaches critical and at least five criteria reach significant, then a data protection impact assessment is processed. The processing by EyeDentity software reaches critical values ‚Äã‚Äãin at least three criteria according to our assessment.

Name: Cat Labs (Crypto Asset Technology Labs)
Products:
CAT Labs is building digital asset recovery and cyber defense tools to enable governments to fight crypto crime and defend against the misuse of emerging technologies. Founded by Lilita Infante, former US DoJ official. The team behind CAT Labs

At the helm of a team of crypto and cybersecurity veterans with deep ties to the U.S. Justice Department is CEO Lili Infante. She is a former U.S. Department of Justice Special Agent and pioneer of an early federal crypto and dark web crimes task force.

Infante is joined by Chief Security Officer Uri Stav, who brings an impressive 25-year experience of leading security teams, having previously held the position of CSDO at Digital Currency Group. 

Additionally, CAT Labs‚Äô Head of Digital Forensics, John Hays, is a former U.S. Department of Justice forensic examiner, specializing in digital asset recovery. With a remarkable 7+ years of experience, Hays assisted in some of the most high-profile federal law enforcement investigations involving cryptocurrencies and the dark web, contributing to the seizure of over $150 million in crypto assets. They might be well-positioned to profit out of Trump's administration race to recover assets and create a bitcoin fund.

Name: Cellebrite
Europol link: RID 2025 + Europol mentioned as having 2 Cellebrite scanning stations, in 2012, and used them - the UFED - in this 2016 migrant smuggling operation in Bulgaria, in this one in Poland in 2019 + mentioned in this website post
Products:
Cellebrite is an Israeli digital intelligence company, staffed by former Israeli military and intelligence officers, that is commonly used by law enforcement across the globe to hack and access data on mobile phones. Its phone data extraction tools have been used to foster surveillance and repression globally: Amnesty's 2024 report found Serbian authorities used it to spy on activists and journalists. See this article:  In Hong Kong, Chinese officials used its technology to hack into the phones of pro-democracy demonstrators, The Intercept reported. According to the Committee to Protect Journalists, police in Botswana have used it to crack the phones of detained journalists. And in Russia, authorities used its technology to hack opposition figures, Haaretz found. In Myanmar, authorities used Cellebrite‚Äôs technology to hack the phones of two Reuters journalists who had uncovered evidence of a Rohingya massacre, in 2018, and were later detained. In Bangladesh, it is used by the Rapid Action Batallion, a violent paramilitary group. According to this article: The company has announced that it has secured business with six of the world‚Äôs biggest oil refiners and six of the planet‚Äôs largest pharmaceutical firms. It has also moved into the increasingly profitable field of corporate surveillance.It already works with ICE, FBI, hundreds of local police departments in the US, is set to expand its market value significantly under new partnerships with UK LEAs, US bodies, and more. 

In Israel, The Jewish News Syndicate reported that Cellebrite helped the government unlock the phones of Hamas operatives who took part in the attacks of October 7. This past summer, Cellebrite allegedly received funding from the Pentagon to develop a product to help identify and map Hamas operatives in Gaza, Calcalist, an Israeli news site, reported earlier this year. Very useful list of Cellebrite's clients here, including use to control migrants.

Name: Bee The Data
Products:
Bee the data is a start-up that began trading in 2015 and is based in Barcelona.
It has been developing software through AI cameras and algorithms that capture, analyse and understand human behaviour in physical areas. The project‚Äôs
website says that LEAs awarded the company a mention of honour. It sells two products:
Beehavior, which employs state-of-the-art deep learning algorithms to capture, analyse and understand human behaviour at physical points from camera feeds, and is used for business purposes.
Beeye, a mass facial recognition technology, able to detect people‚Äôs unique physical characteristics, and is used for security purposes. The company partners with the Catalunya police (Mossos) for the Kuppel System, an intrusive public space surveillance programme combining drone images, camera and AI tools, according to this 2025 report by the LSE.

Name: Paliscope
Europol link: RID 2025 + Europol told MEP Breyer in 2020 it is not using Paliscope (instead, Griffeye)
Products: OSINT tools to analyse big data. Former British Army cyber specialist Joseph Jones represented at RID 2025, along with Christian Berg https://www.linkedin.com/in/christiansjoberg/ "our team delivers technology that helps organizations and authorities process, analyze and document investigative data. Our competencies span wide, including intelligence analysts, developers, expert trainers with law enforcement and military background, AI researchers and many more." Marketed for child abuse, anti trafficking, war crimes in Ukraine. It was sold by the Safer Society Group to Cyberinsight in 2021. Safer Society Group integrated image search tool PimEyes into Paliscope, raising criticism in Germany about the legality to use it in police operations. See also: https://netzpolitik.org/2020/pimeyes-face-search-company-is-abolishing-our-anonymity/  and this commentary.  In May 2021, the data protection authority of Baden-W√ºrttemberg opened an investigation concerning PimEyes. Berg is also the founder of Griffeye, NetClean and Safer Society Groups. (NetClean became in 2013 a partner of the GVT: https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/2-new-private-partners-join-virtual-global-taskforce-effort-combat-online-child. ).Old bio: "Christian Berg has founded the Safer Society Group which consists of the three companies NetClean, Griffeye and Paliscope. NetClean has a suite of products to stop child sexual abuse content, Griffeye has the world‚Äôs premier solution to investigate cases involving huge volumes of images and videos and Paliscope is the tool for online investigations"

Name: SOC Radar
Products: Dark Web and internet intelligence enriched via AI algorithms. Phising and data leaks detection. Big-data powered investigation tool called ThreatHose. SOCRadar is a provider of Extended Threat Intelligence (XTI) delivered via a Software as a Service (SaaS) platform. The offerings of the company include External Attack Surface Management (EASM), Digital Risk Protection Services (DRPS), and Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI). Its platform provides organizations the capacity to enhance their Security Operations Center (SOC) team efficiency by only dealing with valid, actionable, and context-based threat alerts, thereby eliminating the issue of false positives.

Name: Rank One Computing Corporation
Products:
Rank One Computing develops top-tier facial recognition algorithms used to solve mission-critical security issues.

Built atop the only U.S. built facial recognition algorithm with top-tier accuracy and efficiency across all NIST FRVT metrics, ROC Watch offers a responsible & trustworthy real-time face recognition solution.

Rank One Computing was founded by a team of engineers with deep experience in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning offering a fast pace of R&D innovation, consistently improving accuracy release-over-release. Trusted by 70+ integrator customers serving the United States Department of Defense, 20+ law enforcement agencies, multiple Fortune 500 financial institutions, and major global credit card companies, Rank One's mission is to make the world safer and more convenient.In 2020, a black man was wrongfully arrested in Detroit because of a match in the police ROC's system. A black woman was also arrested in 2023 in Detroit.

Name: Axon (Dedrone)
Products: Dedrone is a drone control company, used by military across Europe, the US and beyond for border management, location control. In Oct. 2024: Dedrone, the global leader in airspace awareness and security, is now officially part of Axon. Dedrone is the global leader in smart airspace security. Hundreds of commercial, government and military customers around the world rely on Dedrone's comprehensive, command and control (C2) solution to protect against the persistent and escalating threat from drones while enabling "good" drones to fly. By leveraging AI/ML, Dedrone is the only solution that provides continuous, autonomous interrogation and verification of drones that enables both multi-sensor and multi-mitigation options onto a single "pane-of-glass." Whether on-premise/air-gapped or in the cloud, Dedrone customers can easily detect, track, identify, analyze, and mitigate drone threats.Axon is the technology leader in global public safety. Our moonshot goal is to cut gun-related deaths between police and the public in the U.S. by 50% before 2033. Axon is building the public safety operating system of the future by integrating hardware devices and cloud software solutions that lead modern policing, defense and security. The Axon ecosystem includes TASER energy devices, body-worn cameras, in-car cameras, cloud-hosted digital evidence management solutions, productivity software, real-time operations capabilities and third-party integrations through Axon's partner network. Axon's growing global customer base includes first responders across international, federal, state and local law enforcement, fire, corrections and emergency medical services, as well as the justice sector, commercial enterprises and consumers.
People, products, information: Axon Consulting joined European Cyber Security Organisation (ECSO) in 2022.
